pullRequest.body:
Add `natDegree_pos_of_monic_of_ne_one` lemma which has a rather simple proof, and deduce the other lemmas from that.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

I can't find a way to make `natDegree_pos_of_monic_of_ne_one` into a term mode proof, so more experienced Lean users, please teach me :)

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [544ee59041](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13866/commits/544ee5904130158f80506a7fc4c7ac201e21086b)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Monic.degree_pos`
`+ Monic.degree_pos_of_not_isUnit`
`+ Monic.natDegree_eq_zero`
`+ Monic.natDegree_pos`
`+ Monic.natDegree_pos_of_not_isUnit`
`+ exists_integer_of_is_root_of_monic`
`- degree_pos_of_monic_of_not_isUnit`
`- natDegree_pos_of_monic_of_not_isUnit`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I have proven that now, I don't think it's the proof you were thinking of, but at least it works.

Just wondering, are there any policies on backwards compatability? For example, if I want to remove some lemmas, what do I have to do? I saw some `@[deprecated]` around, but don';t know how to use them. Is this written somewhere?

> Just wondering, are there any policies on backwards compatibility? For example, if I want to remove some lemmas, what do I have to do? I saw some `@[deprecated]` around, but don't know how to use them. Is this written somewhere?

You should do `@[deprecated new_lemma (since := "2024-06-18")] lemma old_lemma ...`
Note that you have a shake issue

I know that the `a` symbol is already used in existing code, but I still think that recycling the available variables is better!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks!

bors d+
I know that the `a` symbol is already used in existing code, but I still think that recycling the available variables is better!

Looks good now

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hap : a âˆ£ p) (hp : Monic p) : ```

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_pos_of_monic_of_ne_one (hu : p â‰  1) (hp : Monic p) :
```
and similarly in the proof and below.

```suggestion
theorem Monic.degree_pos {a : R[X]} (hu : a â‰  1) (ha : Monic a) :
```
or
```suggestion
theorem Monic.degree_pos_of_ne_one {a : R[X]} (hu : a â‰  1) (ha : Monic a) :
```
or maybe even change the statement to
```
theorem Monic.degree_pos {a : R[X]} (hu : a â‰  1) (ha : Monic a) :
```

Whoop sorry I wrote nonsense at the end of my message. I meant maybe even change the statement to
```
theorem Monic.degree_pos {a : R[X]} (ha : Monic a) : 0 < degree a â†”  a â‰  1
```
Yep, exactly what I did in the latest commit :) Do you mind reviewing?

I think you can golf this by first making `eq_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero` an iff (which you could rename to `Monic.natDegree_eq_zero`, which you can itself prove by replacing the use of `eq_C_of_natDegree_eq_zero` by `eq_C_coeff_zero_iff_natDegree_eq_zero` in the existing proof.
Btw, don't prove `Monic.natDegree_pos_of_ne_one`. Prove only `Monic.natDegree_pos`

```suggestion
  Nat.pos_iff_ne_zero.trans hp.natDegree_eq_zero.not
```

```suggestion
theorem Monic.natDegree_eq_zero_iff (hf : p.Monic) : p.natDegree = 0 â†” p = 1 :=
```
Actually here I think the `_iff` is pretty clearly implied by the rest

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Polynomial/RingDivision): Add and simplify some lemmas
